desc: Through visits to the area around Cape Town and Johannesburg/Pretoria, this course examines cultural diversity in South Africa and the important role religion has played in shaping and sustaining the identity of various ethnic and racial groups. Study of the way religious ideas were used to defend the apartheid system and also to justify protest against it. Analysis of organizations, post-apartheid, to build a multi-racial democracy and a just social order. Prerequisite: BTS-B. Offered Interim 2007-08
name: Rel of South Africa
title: Religion and Cultural Diversity in South Africa
